title: How to Make Muddy Buddies

steps.headline: Cover a large baking sheet with wax paper.
steps.description: You will be spreading the finished muddy buddies across this at the end, so that they can cool.

steps.headline: Pour the cereal into a large bowl, and set it aside.
steps.description: Make sure that the bowl is large enough to fit the rest of the ingredients. You will be mixing everything in this bowl at the end.

steps.headline: Put the chocolate chips, peanut butter, and butter/margarine into a microwave-safe bowl.
steps.description: If you really like peanut butter, you can use peanut butter chips instead of chocolate chips. If you don't like peanut butter, try a chocolate-hazelnut spread, such as Nutella, instead.

steps.headline: Microwave on high for 1 minutes, then stir using a spatula.
steps.description: The chocolate won't be quite melted yet, but you still need to stir it. This will help it melt more evenly in the next few steps.

steps.headline: Microwave for another 30 seconds, then stir again.
steps.description: Keep doing this until the chocolate mixture is smooth. There should be no lumps or clumps. Do not melt the chocolate for longer than 30 seconds at a time. Once it starts to melt, it will burn easily. If you heat it too long, it will scorch.

steps.headline: Stir in the vanilla.
steps.description: This will help give the muddy buddies a hint of flavor.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture over the cereal, and stir with a spatula.
steps.description: Try to use a rolling motion, where you bring the cereal from the bottom of the bowl to the top. Also, try to stir gently so that you don't crush the cereal.

steps.headline: Put the cereal mixture into a 2 gallon (7.6 liter) resealable bag.
steps.description: If you don't have a plastic, resealable bag that large, you can also put the cereal mixture into a large, plastic container with a lid. You will be shaking the cereal mixture in this, so make sure that there is enough space for the cereal to move around.

steps.headline: Add the powdered sugar.
steps.description: For something more chocolatey, try dry, brownie baking mix instead.

steps.headline: Close the bag tightly and shake until everything is coated.
steps.description: Be sure to leave plenty of air in the bag when you close it. This will help the cereal move around easier when you shake it. You may have some powdered sugar left over. If this happens, simply toss it out, or save it for another recipe.

steps.headline: Use a spatula to spread the coated cereal across the wax paper so that it can cool.
steps.description: It will take about 10 to 15 minutes for them to cool. Once the cereal cools, it is ready to eat. If you notice any clumped together, gently break them apart using your fingers.

steps.headline: Serve the cooled muddy buddies.
steps.description: Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge. For some extra color, mix in 1 cup (175 grams) of M&Ms, or a similar candy, just before serving. You can even use seasonal mixes for the holidays. For example, you can use red, white, and green M&Ms for Christmas.

steps.headline: Cover a baking sheet with wax paper.
steps.description: You will be spreading the finished muddy buddies across this at the end, so that they can cool. If you'd like to make a multi-colored mix, you will need a separate baking sheet per color.

steps.headline: Fill a large bowl with 4 cups (400 grams) of Chex cereal.
steps.description: This will be enough to make one batch of colored muddy buddies. If you'd like to make multi-colored muddy buddies, you will need a separate bowl for each color. Each bowl will get 4 cups (400 grams) of Chex cereal.

steps.headline: Place the candy melts in a microwave-safe bowl, and heat until melted, stirring every 30 seconds.
steps.description: If you are using more than one color, heat the candy melts in separate bowls. Plan to work with one color at a time. Candy melts are essentially colored white chocolate. You can find them in the baking section of an arts and crafts store.

steps.headline: Pour the melted chocolate into the cereal and stir until combined.
steps.description: If you are using more than one color, pour it into a separate bowl of cereal. Do not mix two colors in the same bowl.

steps.headline: Pour the powdered sugar into a large, resealable bag.
steps.description: This will be enough for one batch of colored muddy buddies. If you are making several different colors, you will need a separate bag for each color. Each bag will get 1/3 cup (40 grams) of powdered sugar. You are using minimal powdered sugar, because if you use too much, the colors won't show as well.

steps.headline: Add the cereal into the bag, zip the bag shut, and shake it until the cereal is evenly coated.
steps.description: The powdered sugar will help keep the cereal from sticking together.

steps.headline: Spread the cereal across the baking sheet using a spatula.
steps.description: Try to spread the cereal as evenly as possible. If you are making other colors, spread each color across as separate baking sheet. If you don't do this, the different colors may stick together and mix.

steps.headline: Wait for the cereal to dry before transferring it to a bowl.
steps.description: The cereal may stick together because of how little powdered sugar you used. If this happens, simply break the cereal apart. If you made multiple colors, consider mixing them all together in one bowl.

steps.headline: Serve the colored muddy buddies.
steps.description: Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge.

steps.headline: Cover a large baking sheet with wax paper.
steps.description: You will be spreading the finished muddy buddies across this at the end, so make sure that you have enough room.

steps.headline: Fill a large bowl with 4 cups (400 grams) of Golden Graham cereal and 3 cups (300 grams) of Chex cereal.
steps.description: Save the remaining 1 cup (100 grams) of Golden Graham cereal for later.

steps.headline: Put the peanut butter and 1 cup (175 grams) of chocolate chops into a microwave-safe bowl.
steps.description: Save the remaining ½ cup (90 grams) of chocolate chips for later.

steps.headline: Microwave the peanut butter and chocolate for 30 seconds, then stir.
steps.description: Keep microwaving and stirring at 30 second intervals until the mixture is smooth. There should be no lumps or clumps.

steps.headline: Stir in 1 cup (100 grams) of the mini marshmallows to the melted mixture.
steps.description: Save the remaining ¾ cup (75 grams) of marshmallows for later.

steps.headline: Pour the mixture over the cereal, and stir with a spatula until the cereal is evenly coated.
steps.description: Try to use a rolling motion, where you are bringing the cereal from the bottom of the bowl to the top. This will help distribute the chocolate mixture more evenly.

steps.headline: Transfer the cereal mixture into a 2 gallon (7.6 liter) resealable bag.
steps.description: If you don't have a plastic, resealable bag, use a large, plastic container with a lid in stead. You will need to shake the cereal with some powdered sugar, so make sure that whatever container you end up using has enough space for the cereal to move about.

steps.headline: Add the powdered sugar.
steps.description: The powdered sugar will coat the cereal, and keep it from sticking.

steps.headline: Zip the bag shut, then shake it until the cereal is completely coated with powdered sugar.
steps.description: When closing the bag, make sure that you leave some air inside it. This will help the cereal move around even more.

steps.headline: Use a spatula to spread the coated cereal across the wax paper so that it can cool.
steps.description: Try to spread the cereal mixture as evenly and thinly as possible. It will take about 10 to 15 minutes for them to cool.

steps.headline: Transfer the cereal into a clean bowl and stir in remaining chocolate chips, mini marshmallows, and cereal.
steps.description: This will great that familiar graham, marshmallow, and chocolate s'mores look.

steps.headline: Serve the muddy buddies.
steps.description: If you have any left over, put them into an airtight container, and store it in the fridge.
